word:
Chap. 177 - To O. A. Olsen

                                       "Sunnyside," Cooranbong, N. S. W. 
                                       April 24, 1896. 

Dear Brother Olsen: 
     I cannot sleep after twelve p.m., and after presenting my case to the Lord, pleading for light and to understand what the will of God is concerning me, I will rest the matter wholly in the hands of God. He careth for me and we are His servants, having our will wholly submerged in the will of God.
